snippet: The tactics used by pharmaceutical companies to drive up diagnosis and sales of their drugs were brazen, often misleading and sometimes deceitful.
abstract: Editorial finds disturbing the hard-sell campaign by drug companies to drive up diagnoses of attention deficit hyperactivity disorder and sales of drugs to treat it; calls on Food and Drug Administration and the Federal Trade Commission to take aggressive action against unwarranted drug treatments; urges doctors and patients to recognize that these pills have downsides.
lead_paragraph: The tactics used by pharmaceutical companies to drive up diagnosis and sales of their drugs were brazen, often misleading and sometimes deceitful.

headline.main: An Epidemic of Attention Deficit Disorder
